content.description: Start on jug below the boulder. Move on ledge right until top out. Do not use the detached block for feet.
Start on the jug below boulder and move straight up the face. Do NOT use the block.

Sit start on a jug and work up and right on good holds. Figure out a way to reach the crack on the face above the roof, and then manage the scary and insecure topout. A key hold on the lip is hollow sounding and flexing, might break off after another winter freeze/thaw.
content.location: On the hidden cave boulder. If facing the creek walk down and left along the creek bank from the fishy boulder to find it.

content.description: Start on the jug under the boulder. Toe hook to start, the kick boulder is off. Bump to a good right hand and kick around to a hand foot match with a right heel. (Hard not to dab) Use slopers to get to the Arete, then make a match on a wide pinch. Exit out to left of the Arete and start hold. Mellow topout
content.protection: Needs one pad, two would be better

content.description:
Sit start with hands on the slopey start and toes hooked around the arete as seen in the picture. Move up and top out over the lip. Make sure to have a spotter as a fall could send you tumbling down the hill.

 Beta Video:
content.location:
A little hard to find, off the side of the trail on the right when walking down to the other boulders on revolutionary ridge. Easiest to find from below, closer to the river.

Google Maps Link

content.description: Start with a hand on the lip and a hand in the tiny but incut crimp under the lip. Make a hard starting move to a juggy flake and then follow jugs up and right.
content.location: The revolutionary ridge boulder. Right of dirty dishes.

content.description:
I believe this is a FA. start with left hand on crimp, and right hand on the obvious hold. Go directly up and over the bulge of the boulder to top out.

 Beta Vid:
content.location: To the left of the main revolution boulder

content.description:
Start on the jug at the base. Boulder at the base is on. Throw a right heel and move left on frictiony holds. Use the arete and crimps to get up and top out.

Beta Video

It's an eliminate, but hey, this is the Wiss. Sit start with hands on the sloping rail at the right end of the boulder. Move left, through textured slopers and the perpetually-soggy crimps and into the big jug underneath the "dirty dishes" holds, without using the dishes. Keep traversing left to the big sharp jug on the arete, or save yourself the pump and shoot directly to the good holds above the jug on the arete. Top out as for Ben Franklin.
content.location: Starts at the right side of the boulder, on the sloping rail below the square-cut jug. The "dirty dishes" holds are off for hands and feet.

content.description: Start as for Dirty Dishes [V3] and bust right using some awkward body tension cross moves. Finish as for I'm Bringing Lobsterbacks [V2].
content.location: Start on the crimps for Dirty Dishes [V3]

content.description: V4- Version: Sit start on crimps in center face. Move up to a jug then work up and right to a large slot without using the jugs out left. Top out above.V3+ Version: Sit start on crimps in center face. Move up using your choice of holds and top out.

Start on the huge jug at the base. Boulder at the base is on. Throw straight up to the lip and top out. Far right jugs and arête are off.

Beta Vid
Sit start with hands on the sloping rail at the right end of the boulder. Make your way left to the "dirty dishes" holds and keep going (crux) until you hit the arete. Top out as for Ben Franklin.
content.location: Starts at the right side of the boulder, on the sloping rail below the square-cut jug.

content.description:
Sit start with a left heel, reach up to the crack and move right. Solid top out.

Beta Vid

Start at the base of Ben Franklin and moves up and right to the obvious positive (and very sharp) horizontal. Follow the progressively smoother and smaller holds moving right to the obvious finish rail. Nice traverse for waiting out the rain.
content.location: It starts at the base of 'Ben Franklin' ends near 'Lobsterbacks'

content.description:
Great spot across the river from the Forbidden Drive parking lot. Can be accessed by doubling back after crossing the first bridge along Forbidden Drive or taking the trail that passes under the Henry Ave bridge.

 Brandon Napieralski put together a great guide for this area: pebblepusher.com/wissahicko…
